thread.title: Less than half of Sydneysiders confident in buying in current market
thread.title_full: Less than half of Sydneysiders confident in buying in current market

author: Brendan Wong Network Real Estate Reporter
title: Less than half of Sydneysiders confident in buying in current market
text:
LESS than half of Sydneysiders believe now is a good time to buy property, a new report reveals.
CoreLogic RP Data Nine Rewards’ latest consumer housing market sentiment survey found only 37.4 per cent of Sydneysiders thought it was good time to buy a home.
The most optimistic regions were Tasmania at 90 per cent, regional South Australia at 85 per cent, Brisbane and in regional Queensland at 78 per cent.
Nationally, 60 per cent of respondents agreed that now was a good time to buy property but this was a drop from 71 per cent at the same time a year ago.
Strong growth in Sydney’s price has made it a tough market to buy in. Credit: DESTINATION NSW Source: Supplied
CoreLogic RP Data research director, Tim Lawless said he was not surprised to see the fall in the number of people who thought now was a good time to buy particularly in Sydney. “[It] can probably be attributed to the high rates of capital that have been recorded over the past few years,” Mr Lawless said.
On the flip side, Sydney respondents were the most optimistic about selling with 89.3 per cent saying it was a good time to sell.
The quarterly survey also surveyed perceptions around foreign buying with 79 per cent of Sydney respondents saying overseas buyers were making it more difficult for Australian residents to own a home.
